subject: Physical Fitness
title: Muscle Hypertrophy Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Muscle Hypertrophy Explained.

hook.text: Lift weights and muscles grow bigger. Everyone knows this. But what actually happens inside the fiber?

buildup.text: Resistance training creates microscopic tears in muscle fibers. Satellite cells rush in to repair them.

discovery.text: The repair adds new protein strands to each myofibril, making the fiber thicker. That's hypertrophy.

twist.text: You don't grow new muscle fibers. The ones you have just get fatter. Fiber count is set at birth.

climax.text: Hypertrophy peaks with 6â€“12 reps at moderate load. Too light or too heavy shifts toward other gains.

punchline.text: Muscles don't multiply. They inflate. Damage is the trigger.
